skill.name: grafana-dashboards
skill.description: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and application metrics. Use when building monitoring dashboards, visualizing metrics, or creating operational observability interfaces.
skill.summary: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and applicatio...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and JSON dashboard examples. No executable code, scripts, file access, network activity, or command execution is present. The content is purely instructional guidance for Grafana dashboard design.

content.user_title: Build Grafana dashboards with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Unstructured dashboards create noise and slow insights. This skill provides clear layouts, panel examples, and alert patterns for effective monitoring.
actual_capabilities: Explain layout hierarchy with RED and USE methods
Provide JSON examples for stat, graph, table, and heatmap panels
Define query variables and show PromQL usage with variables
Show alert configuration patterns inside dashboard JSON
Provide provisioning snippets for dashboards.yml, Terraform, and Ansible
limitations: Does not deploy Grafana or manage data sources
Does not validate PromQL against your metrics
Does not generate full dashboard JSON from live data
Does not configure Grafana notification channels

use_cases.title: Service health overview
use_cases.description: Design an API monitoring dashboard with rate, error, and latency panels.

use_cases.title: Infrastructure visibility
use_cases.description: Plan node and namespace dashboards for CPU, memory, disk, and network trends.

use_cases.title: Business KPI tracking
use_cases.description: Outline dashboards that pair request volume with conversion metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Starter layout
prompt_templates.scenario: First Grafana dashboard for an API
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a simple dashboard layout for an API with request rate, error rate, and P95 latency panels.

prompt_templates.title: Add variables
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Grafana query variables for namespace and service and show how to use them in PromQL.

prompt_templates.title: Alert pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a Grafana alert for error rate above 5 percent over five minutes, including evaluator and query details.

prompt_templates.title: Provisioning plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a provisioning approach using dashboards.yml and Terraform for a production Grafana folder.

output_examples.input: Design an API monitoring dashboard for a production service
output: Layout with top stats, middle time series, and bottom tables
Panels for request rate, error rate percent, and P95 latency
Variables for namespace and service to filter panels
Alert on error rate above 5 percent for five minutes

best_practices: Start with a clear hierarchy from critical metrics to details
Use consistent naming and units across panels
Test dashboards across multiple time ranges
anti_patterns: Mixing unrelated metrics on one panel
Using hardcoded labels instead of variables

faq.question: Is this compatible with Grafana and Prometheus?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples use Grafana dashboard JSON and PromQL for Prometheus data sources.

faq.question: Are there limits on dashboard size?
faq.answer: The skill sets no limits. Grafana performance depends on query load and panel count.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or Ansible?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes example snippets for Terraform dashboard resources and Ansible copy tasks.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static guidance and does not read files or make network calls.

faq.question: My metric names differ. What should I do?
faq.answer: Replace metric names and labels to match your environment and validate in Grafana Explore.

faq.question: How is this different from community dashboards?
faq.answer: It focuses on reusable design principles so you can build custom dashboards.
